title: FR petition filed against police roadblocks hindering protesters
body_lines: A fundamental rights (FR) petition has been filed with the Supreme Court, challenging the setting up of roadblocks by the police and cordoning off roads obstructing the people who are protesting within the legal framework.

Put forward by a resident of Gampaha area, Shenal Jayasekara, the petition has named the Inspector-General of Police, OIC of Colombo Fort Police, the Road Development Authority, Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka and the Attorney General as the respondents.

The petitioner, pointed to media reports on the roadblocks with spikes set up by the police, the roads being cordoned off, installation of permanent roadblocks and blocking the pavement near the Temple Trees in order to hamper the public agitations.

These restrictions were also affected the general public, the petitioner said, stressing that this in violation of fundamental human rights, including the freedom of assembly and protection from torture.

The petitioner seeks a ruling ordering the removal of all roadblocks hindering the general public, to direct the police to seek permission from the Supreme Court before setting up roadblocks, and to direct the IGP to prepare guidelines with regard to installation of roadblocks.
